metadata.case_name: Mohan Lal Goenka & Anr. v. State

facts.text: Goenka was the owner of the Khas Jawbad Colliery, and N. Gupta was the manager of the colliery.
Appellants convicted under s.73 of the Indian Mines Act for contravention of Rule 7 of the Mines Creche Rules, 1946, as no creche attendant as required by that rule had been appointed.
Appeal to the Court of Sessions dismissed.
Revision petition to Calcutta High Court in Criminal Revision No. 270 of 1956, judgment and order dated July 12, 1956; unsuccessful except sentences reduced; certificate under Art.134(1)(c) granted.
Jawabad Mine was one where women were ordinarily employed.
Mines Creche Rules, 1946 framed under s.30(bb) of Mines Act, 1923.
Mines Act, 1923 repealed by s.88 of Mines Act, 1952.
Rule 3 requires owner to construct creche per approved plans; Rule 7 requires owner to appoint creche in charge who is a woman with approved qualifications.

legal_issues.text: Whether Mines Creche Rules, 1946 stood repealed with repeal of Mines Act, 1923 by Mines Act, 1952.
Whether Mines Creche Rules, 1946 framed under s.30(bb) of 1923 Act can be deemed rules under s.58 of 1952 Act given differences in scope.
Whether manager (Gupta) liable for contravention of Rule 7 which in terms lays duty on owner, under s.18 of Mines Act, 1952.

petitioner_arguments.text: Mines Creche Rules, 1946 repealed along with Mines Act, 1923.

Rules framed under s.30(bb) of 1923 Act cannot be deemed under s.58 of 1952 Act as requirements differ; s.30(bb) limited to mines where women ordinarily employed, s.58(d) wider to mines where women employed or were employed in preceding 12 months.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: s.30(bb) Mines Act 1923; s.58(d) Mines Act 1952

petitioner_arguments.text: Manager has no duty under Rule 7(1) which lays duty on owner; s.18 deals only with mining operations, not creche rules or conditions of employment.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Rule 7 Mines Creche Rules 1946; s.18 Mines Act 1952

respondent_arguments.text: Regulations under s.29 of 1923 Act survive repeal; same for rules under s.30.
Creche Rules operate as rules under s.58(d) 1952 Act for mines where women ordinarily employed; Jawabad mine qualifies.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: s.58(d) Mines Act 1952; s.24 General Clauses Act

respondent_arguments.text: Under s.18, owner, agent, manager responsible for all operations conducted in accordance with Act, rules; liable for contravention by any person unless prove took reasonable means to prevent.

court_reasoning.text: Same reasons as in Criminal Appeals Nos. 98-106 of 1959 apply; rules under s.30 of 1923 Act survive repeal.
s.58(d) 1952 Act wider than s.30(bb) 1923 Act but overlaps; rules cover mines where women ordinarily employed, continue by s.24 General Clauses Act; Jawabad mine qualifies.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Rules operate under 1952 Act for this mine; contravention of Rule 7 is offence under s.73 1952 Act.

court_reasoning.text: s.18(1) makes owner, agent, manager responsible for operations in accordance with Act and rules; creche rules part of conditions of employment connected with mining operations.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Narrow view of s.18 rejected; analogous to s.46 restrictions on women employment.

court_reasoning.text: s.18(2) deems owner, agent, manager guilty of contravention by any person unless prove reasonable means to prevent; manager neither suggested nor proved this.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Manager liable even if rule on owner.

court_reasoning.text: Deodatta Diddi not applicable as s.18 not considered; G.D. Bhattar view that manager liable under s.18 correct.

Mudholkar J. dissent: s.18 in Chapter IV on Mining operations and Management; applies only to mining operations (winning minerals), not amenities/employment; manager cannot enforce owner's duty under Rule 7.

holdings.text: Mines Creche Rules 1946 not repealed; continue in force under Mines Act 1952 to extent they overlap with s.58(d).
Rules apply to Jawabad mine as women ordinarily employed there.
Owner, agent, manager responsible under s.18 for compliance with rules like creche rules as part of operations/conditions of employment; liable unless prove prevention efforts.

precedents_cited.relevance: Regulations under s.29 Mines Act 1923 survive repeal; same logic for rules under s.30.

precedents_cited.case_name: State Government, P. v. Deodatta Diddi
precedents_cited.relevance: Agent not liable for Rule 3(1) Coal Mines Pithead Bath Rules as s.18 not considered.
Manager liable under s.18 for creche/pithead bath rules (one judge's view correct).

statutes_cited.name: Mines Act, 1923
statutes_cited.relevance: Rules framed under s.30(bb); repealed by 1952 Act s.88 but rules survive.

statutes_cited.name: Mines Act, 1952
statutes_cited.relevance: Empowers creche rules; offence for contravention; owner/agent/manager duties and liability; women employment restrictions.

statutes_cited.name: Mines Creche Rules, 1946
statutes_cited.relevance: Requires creche construction and appointment of creche in charge; contravened here.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Certificate for appeal to Supreme Court.

outcome.summary: Appeal dismissed; convictions under s.73 Mines Act 1952 for contravention of Rule 7 Mines Creche Rules upheld for both owner and manager. Mudholkar J. would allow manager Gupta's appeal.

key_quotes.text: "the owner, agent and manager of every mine shall be responsible that all operations carried on in connection therewith are conducted in accordance with the provisions of this Act and of the regulations, rules and bye-laws"
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: s.18(1) Mines Act 1952; basis for liability.

key_quotes.text: "In the event of any contravention of any such provisions by any person whosoever, the owner, agent and manager of the mine shall each be deemed also to be guilty of such contravention unless he proves that he had taken all reasonable means... to prevent such contravention."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: s.18(2); vicarious liability key to holding manager guilty.

key_quotes.text: "Employment of labour, providing amenities for them and allied matters would pertain mainly to management and not to Mining operations."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Mudholkar J. dissent limiting s.18 to mining operations.
